senior heavy community in fact 88% of the developers uh were a senior uh there was
a few problems with this one was the lack of professional development that we could offer to our seniors we had quite
a few people with aspirations to lead but unfortunately they didn't have any Juniors to
lead also the cost are hire and the time to fill was quite high for senior developers at the time so it's quite

seniors so we were recruiting for immediate needs so the current hiring efforts were

could come in and hit the ground running um and this uh hiring for
seniors bias created an unnatural void in our Junior Talent pipeline so we wanted to stop recruiting

molded in somebody else's Vision so until this point we were
getting readymade developers that believe strongly in what somebody else had taught them some were quite set in

moving towards microservices and Cloud infrastructure and we really needed our
Dev teams to be a little bit more open-minded than what we were seeing so we thought that graduates could bring in

year as we went along we'd call out if things didn't really feel right uh and

recuitment campaigns then the assessment and then the boot
camp right so if you want to get started running a graduate uh program the first
thing is to recruit your new graduates this was done heavily in conjunction
with the uh recruitment team and the talent acquisition team as well so there's a couple of options and
we investigated them all one is the grad connections website which is a really big online portal where most graduates

The comsi Faculty uh and we opted to do that for two of the

that we ran a very brief Twitter campaign to support our corporate
advertising so we got a whole bunch of applications and the next thing we had to do was assess our

year we focused really heavily on getting Best in Class and we would use words like aade talent and we put a lot
of emphasis on the academic transcripts so looking back this was
because it's it's really easy to measure and it's really easy to quantify we needed to prove to the business uh that
was kind of reluctant to take on new graduates uh that they were getting the best of the best and that their

people so this emphasis on academic transcripts has really decreased over

you don't even need to submit an academic transcript we also ask about three or
four behavioral questions to which the candidates to Pro provide written responses
to so these would focus on their ability to solve problems and also their passions for
Technologies in the first year we ran this we would really evaluate these quite subjectively and uh whether it was

examples of the responses that align with our
values so another really easy way to measure and compare candidates is the
online standard coding tests like um using codility or hacker rank for

100 uh in the first and second year we would stack rank the applicants uh and
that together with their academic transcript uh we would take the highest performers through to our next phase

differently we took a critical look at the way that we were using the coding
results uh if we continue to stack rank our applicants because our applications
were up into the hundreds unless you were getting 100% we weren't even going to look at
you so this was a real problem because there were a lot of people in underrepresented groups that were maybe

program so we gave our standardized test to people across the business uh so
developers of all levels uh contributed and what we found was that if somebody
was getting 60% on this test and they had a real open mind and a willingness
to learn they would probably be a better fit for our graduate
program so now saying that somebody needed 60 % to qualify meant we were opening ourselves up to like hundreds of

seek and figure out how their resume could give us that
information so at there is a really strong emphasis on giving back to the

involved in Tech they running coding camps or attending random hacks of kindness um also their social

were they volunteering and doing charity work uh what about if they did have work

another industry so skills and customer service would really help us build empathy for our
users so this is an example of what our scorecard look like uh so if you were

a standardized coding test and it was about uh four or five points uh for the
resumé codification uh and we still had quite a
substantial pull at this point and if we did Stack rank even based on these points which was the original intent uh
we once again would have ended up with an over representation of male applicants so based on the feedback from

initial reservations the feedback from the assessors and the attendees was that the inclusive culture of the day was

our assessment day look like this to start off with uh we ask our
candidates to come in for a social breakfast where we can talk to them and build a bit of a rapport uh and get to

we run a group activity uh and in this activity we really gauge uh it's kind of
like a team building exercise and we really gauge how people collaborate with each other and how they work in teams we
focus on uh behaviors like inclusion as
well so pair programming our pair programming assessment has really changed over the
years initially we had like a really gamified coding session where the pairs would almost compete against each other
to find bugs uh and find them the fastest uh it's really owed the highly
competitive people to shine and it was not necessarily the only trait we wanted to focus
on so now we rotate coding partners and they work through several simple coding
cards together they get help and advice from our uh assessment supervisors and
we focus on their collaboration skills their willingness to take feedback and their openness to learning new things so

Factor after that they all have a half hour individual interview this was uh

introduced a site tour So based on the feedback from the students of the first round they said they would actually like

office and introduce them to people so after the assessment day uh we
all all the assessors and everybody involved got in a room and we uh had a
1-hour session discussing all the candidates we rated them as exceptional
